awd_titl_txt: US-Ireland Seminar on Trends in Fundamental-Interaction     Research, Dublin, Ireland, May 1989
awd_abstract_narration: This award will support U.S. participation in a week long workshop              in theoretical high energy physics, co-organized by Dr. William                 McGlinn, University of Notre Dame, and Prof. L. O'Raifeartaigh,                 Dublin Institute for Advanced Studies, Dublin, Ireland.  The                    workshop will take place in Dublin in May 1989.                                                                                                                 Theoretical high energy physics is a rapidly moving field with                  major contributors in both the U.S. and Europe.  This seminar will              provide an opportunity for leading researchers to become familiar               with each other's work.  Specifically the discussions will focus                on new results and future trends in the theory of fundamental                   interactions (electromagnetism, gravitation and nuclear forces)                 with emphasis on the unification of these interactions, in                      particular in view of the developments in string theory.
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
